Item.Item: HP Officejet 6700 Premium e-All-in-One H711n Color Ink-jet - Fax / copier / printer / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
HP Officejet 6700 Premium e-All-in-One H711n Color Ink-jet - Fax / copier / printer / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.ReviewTitle: A good value for the price
Item.Review:
This printer has nice features for the price. For me, the multifunction design eliminated a flatbed scanner and copy machine, saving space. Having fax capabilities is a nice plus. I do not often have need for a fax and would not warrant my buying a dedicated fax machine, so it is nice to have one available with this printer when I do.
The standard free shipping was quick. Three days, and I ordered on a weekend. Packing was adequate, the printer arrived in good condition. Initial setup was quick and easy. Little learning curve needed for operation. Operation is quite intuitive and can be done from the printer or computer. The touch screen display on the printer can be pulled out from the bottom to angle the display upward, a nice touch if standing above the machine.
Ok, how do ... es it perform?
Turning it on took a bit longer than I would have thought, about 35 seconds from the time you hit the power button until it cycled through it’s startup routine and was ready to use. The start up process was a little noisier than I expected but not objectionable.
It does a nice job printing. The two sided option printing works fine. So far paper handling has been flawless. Print quality. In my opinion, draft is quite acceptable for routine printing. Normal is noticeably darker and crisper than draft. Best is a little darker than Normal but not as much of a difference as between Draft and Normal. Your needs will dictate how high you need to set quality but I suspect for the majority of users Normal will be more than sufficient and for many draft will do nicely.
The paper tray holds a lot of paper which is nice. However, you do have to remove the paper in order to insert envelopes (or other supported media) for printing. For most that probably is not a problem but if you have to switch between printing documents and envelopes often it may be.
For scan, copy and fax you can use the flatbed scanner or the document feeder as your input source. The document feeder works nicely and ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Officejet 6700 Premium e-All-in-One H711n Color Ink-jet - Fax / copier / printer / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.ReviewTitle: Very Convenient to use with Innovative Features
Item.Review: I have ordered this HP Officejet 6700 Premium after reading and considering a wealth of reviews from HP.com and other websites that sell this product. I even searched this printer at the local Bestbuy store but it was not available. This printer is very easy to set up. Although when I tried to set up the wireless printing capability, the machine says "password error" though I checked and rechecked and I was sure that I entered the right password. I was tempted to call the HP support service but I tried first to choose the option of connecting the computer via USB instead of chosing wireless and it worked. Then I changed from USB connection to wireless without any hassle. You can print practically anywhere within the corners of your home where internet signal is present using the wireless p ... rinting. However, even if you are away from home, you still can send printing works using eweb printing by sending the file to the printer's email. If you know how to send an email, you know how to print an email to HP Officejet 6700 because its just like sending an email and having it printed as well. I have tried also using the SCAN option and I was so impressed. You have an option of sending the scan wirelessly to your computer of having it stored in the flashdrive. Printing files directly from the flashdrive is also easy without using computer. Although I have set up the FAX on this printer, I haven't tried using it yet. I am still about to test how often should I change ink cartriges against the frequency of printing usage. However, with this printer priced at $119.00 from its original price of $169,(weeks ago it was priced at $139) I think I saved already a lot. I would also give credit to FedEx for the fast delivery of this printer. I chose the Free Delivery for 5-8 days but in 3 days time it was delivered at our doorstep. Overall, I would recommended this HP Officejet 6700 to anyone who wants to experience printing and scanning convenience as well as innovation in web eprin ... expand » « collapse

Item.ReviewTitle: The quality of the printing is great.
Item.Review: After reading reviews on this printer, I decided to purchase this model. One of the reviews stated that it was very easy to setup. That was true up to a point. The directions are one sheet of pictures. Since I am not mechanically incline, I would have appreciated some writtent instructions with the pictures. Trying to discern what an arrow is pointing to in a picture isn't always easy; especially for a senior citizen. It took me two days to setup the printer. I think it would have been quicker it I had had some written instructions with the pictures.

Item.Item: HP Officejet 6700 Premium e-All-in-One H711n Color Ink-jet - Fax / copier / printer / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review:
Cons: Hard To Use; Unreliable; Inefficient
The printer worked well for about two days. It was easy to set up wireless printing on my network and I printed exactly once from each of our laptops. After that the problems began: 1. The double sided printing feature does not work. 50% of the time the printer sucks the paper back in, chews it to pieces, jams itself and gives multiple error message. We have wasted a great deal of paper trying to save it with this printer. 2. It drops off the network constantly and has never again printed from any of our wireless devices. 3. It uses excessive amounts of ink, including color although we have never printed in color. 4. The printer gives an error message and refuses to print about 3 out of every 4 print jobs. We must then res ... tart the printer. 5. Most of the time we try to restart the printer it freezes. We have tried to wait it out but the printer stays frozen for hours. We must then unplug and re-plug in the printer. This results in multiple error messages and 30+ minutes in wasteful automatic test pages.
If you do get these printer be aware that you have only 14 days to return it to Staples, then it is on the apparently endless chain of HP 'Support' people. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Officejet 6700 Premium e-All-in-One H711n Color Ink-jet - Fax / copier / printer / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.ReviewTitle: This is JUST what I needed
Item.Review: I am secretary of a non profit and needed to print labels, address envelopes, make our own thank you cards for donations. I have been working with an HP1600 forever. It finally gave me enough trouble that I didn't want to worry about it doing the job anymore. This HP6700 premium is such a dream! I hooked it up by myself in practically no time and the results I achieved were unbelievable. The printer is quiet, so wonderful to be able to do many varied tasks, I am so happy I chose this one. Almost all of the reviews I read were positive and Cnet rated it very highly. Good enough for me! Thank you, HP! I got a great "back to school" price on it too!

Item.Item: HP Officejet 6700 Premium e-All-in-One H711n Color Ink-jet - Fax / copier / printer / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review:
I have owned MANY HP printers - Photosmarts, Officejets and Laserjets (8750, c309a, c410a, c5180, 5610, 2420d, 8000, etc.) I have loved some - (the 8750 and c410a are my favorites...in fact, the 8750 has been the best printer I've ever owned, and I still use it as my primary printer). But, I have not liked others (the c309a was a good wired printer, but I bought it for its wireless capability, which failed a year after I bought it). This new printer - the Officejet 6700 - has returned HP to it's rightful place atop the consumer printing world.
Setup was easy. Connection was immediate (wireless). Printing, scanning and emailing (to the printer) is all done remotely. I will put it somewhere in the house near a phone line (for the fax function), and forget about it until I need it. The ... n I will remotely scan something I've placed on the glass, or I'll wirelessly print to the photo or general paper trays.
And, every so often we'll get a call from one of my two brothers in law to go pick up a picture that's sitting in the arrival slot...because they've just emailed THE PRINTER a picture of their respective newborn babies, and the picture JUST PRINTS! I LIKE this printer. My wife (their sister) LOVES this printer!!
Good job, HP! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Officejet 6700 Premium e-All-in-One H711n Color Ink-jet - Fax / copier / printer / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review:
About a month ago I purchased another HP (model) printer which I hated. I exchanged it for this one paying a bit more money for this. This printer was so easy to install and everything worked right away. I use all functions and have found this model so easy to use. The scanner works and I have used the fax daily. It holds plenty of paper and the printer feeds well. So far, so good. What a difference from the first model I tried a month ago. There are no cons (so far). I highly recommend this printer.
I do wish HP equipment came with manuals - hate looking things up in the web manual - what a pain but I guess that's how it is anymore. I always study the manuals and take with me as I run errands (and have to wait) but would have to print the darn thing out to do that and they are too ... long. It would benefit everyone if a manual were included with the equipment! expand » « collapse

I don't have any issues with it so far and it runs well. It does may a lot of strange noises when it setting up and cleaning and I wonder with all this extra movement limits the shelf life of these printers. It did with the 6500A.

As for faxing documents using you eprint, that's very easy as well. Just remember to set-up an account with HPe-print, after installing the printer software.
If you are thinking about purchasing a printer, copier, scanner, and fax machine. PLEASE consider the product! It works GREAT!

I am switching to a heavier paper stock to see if that will prevent the issue from happening again. 3) It doesn't like to scan if the flat bed is being used with the top up -- so then what's the point of the flatbed????
It's OK -- not great.

Item.Review: After two weeks of use the 6700 Premium All-in-One has performed excellent. Setup was easy and each facet of the machine tested okay on the first attempt. Quite a step up from my old 6310 Office jet all-in-One printer. Now I am hoping I get the same longevity from this one.

Item.Review:

Cons: Hard To Use; Ink Costs

Lots of features are included in this unit. Duplexing and e-print have to be my favorites. For such an expensive (upfront) printer, ink should be cheaper.
If screen responsiveness was improved I would increase 1/2 a star. If ink was cheaper, that would be another 1/2 = 5 Stars.

It said I'd have it the next day...Well, I did! I ordered it and had it in hand in 18 hours. That's great service. So far love this machine. Great color resolution, copy,scan and fax are so easy to use. I never write recommendations, but felt I had to because this experience was so awesome!

Item.Review:

Cons: Unreliable; Hard To Use; Can't FAX on digital line
This is really a 3 in 1 machine, not an "All in One". May work well as a FAX on an analog line but in a digital world it won't work on a digital phone line. Interestingly the HP printer we used for years that this machine replaced had no issues with the digital phone line. So much for backward compatibility. As a printer, copier & scanner have no problems and the setup was a breeze.

The only negative is that I have used it for about two weeks and it is telling me the ink is low. Other than that I am very happy with my purchase.

Item.Item: HP Officejet 6700 Premium e-All-in-One H711n Color Ink-jet - Fax / copier / printer / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review: I am very pleased with my 6700 Officejet. It arrived very quickly and was very easy to install and set up. Although it is a little slow to start printing, it produces quality prints quickly and the ink cartridges last! The screen is easy to maneuver my way through and I have recommended it to several people already. I just about gave up on HP printers after the 4500 but this has renewed my faith.

Item.Item: HP Officejet 6700 Premium e-All-in-One H711n Color Ink-jet - Fax / copier / printer / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.ReviewTitle: Not good for college if your PC only has USB 3.0
Item.Review: I purchased this printer for use at college with a new laptop. It has a great feature set along with good quality scanning and printing. I connected the printer to the USB ports on the PC (it only has USB 3.0 ports). Printing repeatedly hung and crashed the PC. Research found an HP support person explaining that these printers do not work with USB 3.0 and recommended users use the printer's wireless feature. This workaround would be fine for my home network, but it's not good for college. Since student printers cannot be connected to the university network and the printer's wireless has to have access to a router, I had to purchase a router for the printer and PC to connect to. This works with no hangs or crashes.

Item.Item: HP Officejet 6700 Premium e-All-in-One H711n Color Ink-jet - Fax / copier / printer / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review: The things I would change are: They need a document in the box showing pictures of the items that are included, and what these items actually look like - The power plug is ridiculous, and I have to sit the printer on top of the wire to keep the plug from falling out - Replacing the black return paper tray with clear, would be very helpful so it isn't necessary to keep checking the amount of paper in the tray below -The envelope set up is terrible. I don't have need to print a bunch of envelopes at one time, so this is very inconvenient. Other than that ... I love this printer. It is great on ink. I have been printing like crazy on the ink that came with the printer. Let me just say this, I purchased another brand of printer because they claimed the ink was inexpensive and lasts a long time ... . I could have purchased 2 of these new HP printers for the money I spent on ink alone from the other brand printer in just the past 3 months. I was so angry, I put it back back in the box and placed it at the end of the driveway (vs throwing it out the window) with a sign FREE. As a freebee, they can afford the ink. What was I thinking...I know HP printers always work! Oh, and the print quality not only on this new printer, but our other 10 year old HP printer is wonderful. The colors are great too. I am glad I purchased this printer. expand » « collapse

Item.Review: Since ink cartridge prices are immoral for all home printers in general; My opinion of this machine could change depending on how long the ink lasts . Item.Review: This printer has great features and I had an easy time to visit all the assorted new features that my older printer did not have. I just love the product. HP is a favorite brand that I trust.

Item.Item: HP Officejet 6700 Premium e-All-in-One H711n Color Ink-jet - Fax / copier / printer / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review: Back in May, I have made a purchase to the HP OfficeJet 6700 Premium e-all-one printer, after two months of use, I was duly impressed with its features and performance. The features were very impressive, for it provided me convenience and ease when performaning task such as sending documents using the scanning feature on pdf format. It holds up to over two hundred sheets of paper in addition to allowing me to print double-sided documents. When I use the copy feature to make copies of items, the copy looks almost like the original, especially when it is run on color. The amazing performance is when the printer is used for air-printing via wireless, it allows me to print items while I am away from home especially, when I am using my iphone to send documents to my home printer. I find it t ... o be highly useful when performaning task via cloud, thus providing convenience rather, than having to pay a fee to use other air or cloud printers in public establishments. There are many other tasks and features that are to many to mention in this review, but to make it short and simple, this multifunction printer, does exceed my expectations. That is all I have to mention about this great printer. expand » « collapse

Just have to add my son's laptop so he can start printing his summer assignments for school. The speed from which we hit the print button to the time it starts to print seems a little slow, but by the time we get downstairs it's kicking out the pages!

Item.Review:
Pros: Double-Sided Printing; Easy To Set Up; Easy to Use; Efficient; Reliable; Print Speed
Cons: Expensive Ink; Four Cartridges to Buy
Overall, I am happy with this purchase. The 6700 Premium is worth the investment - with double sided printing, printing from mobile devices, dedicated email address printing and above-average-size paper tray. The drawback, as with any non-commercial printer, is the cost and nuisance of multiple printer ink cartridges that always seem to empty and require replacement at different intervals.

Item.Review: Wireless and double-sided printing were requirements for my next printer replacement. It's a little annoying that every page is double-sided when the feature is turned on. Even a one-page document still has to be "flipped" by the printer before it's done with it. Initial set-up was easy, but slow (I opted to install updates) - enough that I was wondering if it had failed. The printer makes a bit of noise but nothing dramatic. HP Apps is a neat feature. My child quickly figured out how to print crossword puzzles and cartoons.

Item.Item: HP Officejet 6700 Premium e-All-in-One H711n Color Ink-jet - Fax / copier / printer / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.ReviewTitle: Longest Nightmare and not over yet
Item.Review:
HP Officejet 6700 Premium e-All-in-One Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax
Purchased this product a week ago. Install was simple and easy and worked wireless and USB just fine. Scan worked very well--quite fast either wireless or USB...HOWEVER...
A day or so later the communication between print and computer through new HP Officejet 6700 Premium e-All-in-One Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax network would stop and require computer reboot to re-enable. Obviously this was unacceptable so I called HP to get resolved.
To recap, the printer works, the software is a problem.

Item.Item: HP Officejet 6700 Premium e-All-in-One H711n Color Ink-jet - Fax / copier / printer / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review: Have not used everything on it yet but what I have used works really great. This printer has amazing speed! Scanner is so fast and quiet you will be surprised it scanned. Like it a lot.

Item.Item: HP Officejet 6700 Premium e-All-in-One H711n Color Ink-jet - Fax / copier / printer / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review:
I've only had this product for a month (so I won't discuss quality or longetivity).
Setup - I've setup a lot of printers in my time and this has to be simplest yet. The printer comes assembled and requires little hands on work to get on the desk and turned on. My printer connected to the wireless network on the first try. I will say that software and PC setup was boringly slow, but it was still easy. You have to be patient with all the configurations to use the features. Just be patient and get through it. :)
Features - Gotta love the feature set on this printer. I've used all of them in testing and real world use. My favorite, by far, is being able to print from anywhere using ePrint and Google Cloud Print. Printing from home works as expected and printing in general is a li ... ttle slow on Page 1 of a print job when the printer is asleep, but speedy afterwards. The Auto Doc Feeder feature is great for scanning, but could be a little faster - not a dealbreaker. It's nice to be able to scan from the printer and it auto saves to my PC (again part of the dreadfully painful setup process) without any effort.
I'm satisfied up to this point. :) expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Officejet 6700 Premium e-All-in-One H711n Color Ink-jet - Fax / copier / printer / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review: Three problems: 1) almost immediately a yellow triangle with exclamation point appeared next to printer icon when selecting a printer with no indication of what the problem might be. The triangle never appears in the printer/scan System Preferences section of the Mac. Tech support solution is to plug the cord directly into wall socket, not a power surge connector. This works sometimes but is not consistently replicable. The problem, I'm told, is endemic to all-in-one printers. 2) New Software Update from Mac does not recognize successful installation of HP Printer Software Update version 2.8, 5.8 mb. I still get the update message after 6 hours with Mac tech support and complete reinstallation of OS 10.7.3) 3) I bought a $39.95 full year tech support contract for a Photosmart 4780 at the s ... ame time I got the 6700 all-in-one. I was told at the time that the contract applied to ALL HP printers in the house (we have three): it doesn't. The person was VERY knowledgeable, and I spent over 45 minutes with him. This was not a slip of the tongue or a misinterpretation on my part. Other than all of these things, the printer works fine with printing, scanning, and copying, although the fax is still smudgy (supposedly linked to not having the printer directly plugged into wall socket). How many people have enough wall sockets to save one for the printer alone? expand » « collapse
